p: Norfloxacin and ciprofloxacin were used in the tests with the 1199B and K2068 strains, respectively. These strains carry the NorA and MepA efflux proteins, respectively, which confer resistance to the corresponding antibiotic. Ethidium bromide was used as an efflux pump inhibitor control. Both antibiotics were dissolved in DMSO and diluted in water, while ethidium bromide was dissolved in water. All drugs were prepared at initial concentrations of 1024 Âµg/mL and serially diluted in test tubes. Both antibiotics, ethidium bromide and safrole were purchased from SIGMA Chemical Co. (St. Louis, MO, USA).
